entries.title: China's Baidu Sees Little Impact From U.S. Chip Controls
entries.description: A company executive says the search-engine giant’s AI and cloud businesses don’t rely heavily on chips restricted by the U.S.

entries.title: What Is Cultivated Meat, and When Can We Eat It?
entries.description: Lab-grown meat uses animal cells while trying to reduce animal harm, illness and environmental impact.

entries.title: Zoom Stuck in Single-Digit Purgatory for a While
entries.description: A slowdown in corporate tech spending comes at a bad time for the videoconferencing icon’s effort to build a more stable revenue base.

entries.title: HP Plans Layoffs With PC Demand Slump Stretching Into Next Year
entries.description: The company said it would slash up to 12% of its workforce. Dell also warned of a worsening decline after a 17% drop in third-quarter laptop and desktop sales.

entries.title: Ads Often Run on Websites That Come With High Carbon Emissions but Low Returns
entries.description: Marketers are often running digital ads on websites that provide relatively low returns on their investment but generate comparatively high carbon emissions, a new study said.

entries.title: Iger Returns to Disney Facing Radically Different Streaming Landscape
entries.description: The incoming CEO championed Disney+, but needs to steer streaming business toward profitability without cannibalizing other Disney units.

entries.title: Digital Currency Group Says Revenue Will Fall This Year
entries.description: DCG owes its Genesis unit around $575 million that is due in May 2023, in addition to a $1.1 billion promissory note to Genesis due in June 2032.

entries.title: Facebook's Most Popular Posts Were Trash. Here Is How It Cleaned Up.
entries.description: Facebook’s third-quarter Widely Viewed Content Report, released on Tuesday, shows only one in the top 20 posts qualified as engagement bait, down from 100% a year earlier. For the first time since the report began being produced, none of the top 20 posts violated platform rules.

entries.title: FTX Lawyer Says 'Substantial Amount' of Crypto Firm's Assets Stolen or Missing
entries.description: The cryptocurrency platform is making its first appearance at a Delaware bankruptcy court since filing the largest-ever crypto chapter 11.

entries.title: Apple, Google Face In-Depth Antitrust Probe of Mobile Market Power in U.K.
entries.description: The British competition regulator said it is moving forward with a market investigation into how the companies control web browsers for mobile devices.

entries.title: JD.com Cuts Executive Pay as China's Tech Firms Tighten Belts
entries.description: The e-commerce company will reduce the compensations of some 2,000 senior managers by 10%-20% from next year.

entries.title: Foxconn Hires Chip Veteran in Diversification Drive
entries.description: The Taiwanese contract manufacturer hired Chiang Shang-yi, a veteran with decades of experience at some of the world’s biggest chip makers, to drive further expansion into semiconductors and bolster its supply chain.

entries.title: Is Elon Musk Your Boss's Anger Translator?
entries.description: Many leaders who think the working world has gone soft in recent years envy the new Twitter chief’s unfiltered style and push for maximum effort from employees.

entries.title: Crypto Lender Genesis Asks Binance and Apollo for Cash
entries.description: Genesis told clients last week that it paused lending withdrawals while it shored up cash.

entries.title: What to Expect as FTX Debuts Biggest Crypto Chapter 11 in Court
entries.description: FTX is expected to make its debut appearance Tuesday in Delaware bankruptcy court, where its new management is expected to recount events leading up to the cryptocurrency platform’s sudden collapse and explain the steps it has since taken to secure customer funds.
